Uru Taha gang boss Anthony Heke jailed for bashing over stolen money claim https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/uru-taha-gang-boss-anthony-heke-jailed-for-brutal-bashing-over-claim-of-stolen-money/6HXTFYNU7FA5VLY53F4QSS6T4U/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/uru-taha-gang-boss-anthony-heke-jailed-for-brutal-bashing-over-claim-of-stolen-money/6HXTFYNU7FA5VLY53F4QSS6T4U/ Tara ShaskeyThe victim was on his couch when three gang members walked into his home and attacked him. Sun, 05 May 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Uru Taha gang president Anthony Joel Heke was sentenced in New Plymouth District Court to five years and three months for bashing an associate.

Photo / Mead Norton
Spike in murdered women in Australia sparks outrage, highlights New Zealand’s own problems - The Front Page https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/spike-in-murdered-women-in-australia-sparks-outrage-highlights-new-zeallands-own-problems-the-front-page/RHV7DDLPN5CJPLQR76TJXFFKWA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/spike-in-murdered-women-in-australia-sparks-outrage-highlights-new-zeallands-own-problems-the-front-page/RHV7DDLPN5CJPLQR76TJXFFKWA/ Chelsea DanielsAustralian women have protested over a rise in murdered females across the country. Sun, 05 May 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Demonstrators take part in a national rally against violence towards women on April 27, in Sydney, Australia. Australians turned out in large numbers to call for an end to gender-based violence. Photo / Getty Images
